hackathon-description-text: student hackathons are deisgned to provide NYC high school students from under-resourced communities the opportunity to develop their coding skills and work alongside professionals from NYC's tech community. Presented by the

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Executive Director, Innovate NYC Schools, NYCDOE
Managing Director, Global Ads Marketing, Google
Group Head, Innovation Management, MasterCard Labs

hackathon-eligibility: This challenge is open to all New York City high school students who have
hackathon-requirements: Participants must conceive of an idea that addresses the Code4Tomorrow theme of identifying ways to make a positive change in NYC communities. Two digital products must be submitted:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Cash value above assumes a team of five. Each student on the first place team will receive: $100 + a yearlong subscription for website hosting on Squarespace ("Personal" package worth $96 per year).
Cash value above assumes a team of five. Each student on the second place team will receive $50.
Cash value above assumes a team of five. Each student on the third place team will receive $25.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
How innovative is the idea?
How well does the idea address a problem in a NYC community?
How complete is the prototype? How intuitive is the user interface?
How appropriate is the design and content for reaching the target customer? How well did students apply the Mozilla Webmaker tools and simple HTML/CSS learned throughout the day?
How well did the team members articulate their idea? How convincing was the presentation?

hackathon-location-address: 11 Times Square, New York, NY 10036, USA
hackathon-description-header: With the help of industry mentors, NYC high school students will build digital products that aim to make a positive change in NYC communities.
